summary: This bill, the Upper Price River Watershed Project Act of 2025, directs the Secretary of the Interior to transfer approximately 124.23 acres of Bureau of Land Management land in Utah to the city of Price for public purposes.  It defines key terms like "City," "Federal land," "Map," and "Secretary." The conveyance is subject to existing rights and the map is available for public inspection, with provisions for correcting minor errors. The bill bypasses certain sections of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976.
